newsitem.title: USA: FCOJ futures end lower in brisk technical trade.
newsitem.headline: FCOJ futures end lower in brisk technical trade.

text.p: NYCE frozen concentrated orange juice futures closed weaker as prices continued to brush off a slowly moving cold front expected to reach Florida later this week.
The weather system is expected to pressure temperatures across the Florida citrus belt into the 30s (degrees Fahrenheit) by Friday but still not low enough to threaten the crop, forecasters said.
"There is a slight chance of frost but certainly not enough to damage the fruit," Mike Palmerino, a meteorologist with Weather Services Corp in Boston, said.
Frost can be seen around 33 degrees to 37 degrees Fanhrnheit, he said. The temperature would have to dip under 25 degrees to cause a freeze.
Prices opened weaker and set the range early, with the most-active March contract sinking to its life-of-contract low of 92.80, in early trade.
The contract settled 1.10 cents weaker at 93.85 cents a pound, traded 94.80 to 92.80. Spot January went out 1.00 cent lower at 90.40 cents.
